CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 11 - Freedom of assembly and association (Article 11-1 - Freedom of peaceful assembly)
JUDGES: András Sajó;Guido Raimondi;Helen Keller;Nebojša Vučinić;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to ORG for authorisation for a political demonstration in front of ORG , in FAC , a vast open area traditionally used for political demonstrations . The declared objectives of the demonstration were , among others , commemoration of the revolution of DATE and of the tumultuous events in GPE in DATE as well as to call attention to the perceived absence of legal certainty in the country . The event was scheduled for DATE , CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . According to ORG ’s official and public activity log available on the Internet , the only event taking place on that date in ORG ’s building was a conference and DATE organised by ORG under the title “ Employment – Equality of Chances – Competitiveness ” . No parliamentary session was scheduled .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG proposed to the applicant that the planned demonstration be held in a secluded part of FAC , rather than its entirety . The applicant refused this suggestion .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG forbade the demonstration . It was of the view that the planned demonstration would ‘ gravely endanger’ the functioning of ORG , which was a legitimate ground for prohibiting it under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW . In particular , the speeches and music – belonging in the programme and DATE might disturb the MPs’ work . Moreover , the participants – whose number was estimated at CARDINAL persons – might physically impede the MPs’ driving in and out of ORG ’s car park , which , in the authority ’s view , amounted to restricting their freedom of movement and to inhibiting the functioning of the organ of the people ’s representation .

CARDINAL . The applicant applied for judicial review . He submitted in particular that another demonstration with an agenda identical to his but scheduled for DATE , DATE , had not been forbidden on exactly the same location ; this fact showed , in his view , discrimination against him and his planned event . According to ORG ’s official and public activity log available on the Internet , on DATE parliamentary commissions were in session .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed his complaint , endorsing in essence ORG reasoning .
